meta.description: Location data for The Great Divide Trail

regions.name: New Mexico Territory
regions.description: The arid lands of the Southwest, home to ancient pueblos and Spanish settlements.

regions.name: Colorado High Country
regions.description: Towering peaks and treacherous mountain passes of the central Rockies.

regions.name: Wyoming Basin
regions.description: Wide open plains and rugged badlands stretching beneath endless skies.

regions.name: Montana Wilderness
regions.description: Dense forests, rushing rivers, and the northern Rocky Mountain frontier.

regions.name: British North America
regions.description: The vast wilderness claimed by the Hudson's Bay Company.

regions.name: Yukon Territory
regions.description: A frozen land of endless boreal forest and unforgiving cold.

regions.name: Russian America
regions.description: The remote Pacific coast, domain of Russian traders and Tlingit peoples.

locations.name: Santa Fe
locations.description: The ancient capital of New Mexico, where your journey begins. Adobe buildings line dusty streets, and traders from Mexico bring goods north along the Camino Real.

locations.name: Taos Pueblo
locations.description: An ancient pueblo at the foot of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains. The Taos people have lived here for centuries.

locations.name: San Luis Valley
locations.description: A vast high-altitude valley ringed by mountains. The Rio Grande flows through its heart.

locations.name: Poncha Pass
locations.description: A critical mountain crossing at 9,000 feet. Snow lingers here well into summer.

locations.name: South Park Basin
locations.description: A broad mountain park surrounded by peaks. Bison herds still roam here, and game is plentiful.

locations.name: Blue River Camp
locations.description: A small trapper camp along the Blue River. A handful of mountain men winter here.

locations.name: Gore Pass
locations.description: Named for a wealthy Irish hunter, this pass cuts through the Gore Range at 9,500 feet.

locations.name: Steamboat Springs
locations.description: Natural hot springs bubble from the earth here. The water sounds like a steamboat engine.

locations.name: Bridger Pass
locations.description: A gentle crossing through the southern Rockies, used by Jim Bridger himself.

locations.name: South Pass
locations.description: The great gateway through the Rockies. The Continental Divide crosses here at a gentle grade.
locations.milestone: You have crossed the Continental Divide!

locations.name: Fort Bridger
locations.description: A trading post established by the legendary mountain man Jim Bridger. A vital resupply point.

locations.name: Wind River Range
locations.description: Jagged granite peaks and alpine lakes. The Shoshone people call this place home.

locations.name: Yellowstone Country
locations.description: A strange land of geysers, hot springs, and bubbling mud. Trappers tell tales of this place.

locations.name: Bozeman Pass
locations.description: A narrow pass through the Bridger Mountains, gateway to the Montana goldfields.

locations.name: Three Forks
locations.description: Where the Jefferson, Madison, and Gallatin rivers join to form the Missouri. Lewis and Clark camped here.

locations.name: Last Chance Gulch
locations.description: A rough mining camp where prospectors pan for gold in the streams.

locations.name: Marias Pass
locations.description: A treacherous crossing through the northern Rockies. Blackfoot territory lies beyond.

locations.name: Flathead Lake
locations.description: The largest natural freshwater lake west of the Mississippi. Salish tribes fish its waters.

locations.name: Kootenai River Crossing
locations.description: You have crossed into British territory. The Hudson's Bay Company claims these lands.
locations.milestone: You have entered British North America!

locations.name: Fort Kootenay
locations.description: A Hudson's Bay Company trading post. British traders exchange goods with local tribes.

locations.name: Rocky Mountain Trench
locations.description: A vast valley running north between mountain ranges. The route is easier here.

locations.name: Peace River Country
locations.description: Wild and remote, the Peace River flows east toward Lake Athabasca.

locations.name: Fort Nelson
locations.description: A remote HBC outpost. The last major trading post before the Yukon.

locations.name: Liard River Crossing
locations.description: A dangerous river crossing. The Liard is swift and cold. You have entered the Yukon.
locations.milestone: You have entered the Yukon Territory!

locations.name: Yukon Plateau
locations.description: A frozen highland of permafrost and stunted trees. Winter comes early here.

locations.name: Pelly River Camp
locations.description: A seasonal camp used by Kaska people. They may trade with travelers.

locations.name: Chilkoot Pass
locations.description: The final mountain barrier. Tlingit traders have used this route for generations.

locations.name: Dyea
locations.description: A Tlingit village at the foot of the Chilkoot. The sea is near.

locations.name: Juneau Icefield
locations.description: A vast expanse of glacial ice. The route skirts its edges along the coast.

locations.name: Sitka (New Archangel)
locations.description: The capital of Russian America! Onion domes rise above the harbor. You have completed your journey along the Great Divide.
